Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Mature Animal Style or Sphinx and Lion Style pottery open vase, cup or kantharos; white slip; interior glazed black; part of rosette in added white outline with added red centres above two white lines; exterior: two black-figure friezes separated by narrow band; above, sphinx seated to left (part of back, haunch, hind leg and part of tail remaining; red on haunch); part of incised rosette as filling ornament; below, part of wing of sphinx (to right).
Curator's comments: The cup shape is not common in the Sphinx and Lion Style; contemporary with that style is the Animal Chalice Style in which cups (though not kantharoi) are the most typical form. Yet incision is not found on vases of the Animal Chalice Style even if the subject matter and filling ornament on this sherd are very typical of that style. This cup, one of only a few, appears to be influenced by both styles. For another example, see British Museum 1924,1201.208.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1647) (phase 2)
